experiment_info.name: smart_early_termination
experiment_info.description: Detect convergence and terminate CMA-ES early to save time for hard samples
experiment_info.hypothesis: Some samples may be easy where CMA-ES converges quickly

reason_aborted: EARLY STOPPING FAMILY EXHAUSTED. Multiple prior experiments prove: (1) cmaes_early_stopping showed 1% threshold NEVER triggered - CMA-ES keeps improving >1% per generation, (2) adaptive_sample_budget showed early termination HURTS accuracy, (3) confidence_based_early_exit showed stopping early prevents covariance adaptation.

cmaes_early_stopping.result: FAILED - stagnation threshold was NEVER triggered
cmaes_early_stopping.finding: CMA-ES continues making meaningful improvements (>1%) throughout budget
cmaes_early_stopping.quote: The 1% threshold is too tight: CMA-ES makes >1% improvements in most generations, even near the end

adaptive_sample_budget.finding: When CMA-ES terminates early (23.8% samples), accuracy drops significantly (-0.018 score)
adaptive_sample_budget.quote: Any form of early termination for CMA-ES - the algorithm needs its full budget

confidence_based_early_exit.finding: Stopping early means stopping before the covariance matrix is well-adapted, which always hurts accuracy

key_insight: The proposed 0.1% threshold is even tighter than the 1% threshold that never triggered in cmaes_early_stopping. CMA-ES needs its full budget for covariance adaptation. There is NO convergence-based criterion that works for this problem.
